noun.description: A framework of spaced bars that are parallel to or cross each other; a grating.
examples: the metal grids had been pulled across the foyer

noun.description: A network of lines that cross each other to form a series of squares or rectangles.
A network of cables or pipes for distributing power, especially high-voltage transmission lines for electricity.
examples: the second reactor was not connected to the grid until 1985

noun.description: An electrode placed between the cathode and anode of a thermionic tube or cathode ray tube, serving to control or modulate the flow of electrons.

verb.description: Put into or set out as a grid.
examples: a well-planned core of gridded streets

phrases: people living off the grid had begun using wind turbines
First, I found that living off the grid wasn't very hard; it was actually quite fun.
Langer suggests building small hydro plants along fast-flowing streams to supply power to farms that are off the grid.
Jan Hopkins reports on those who were off the grid during the worst blackout in our country's history.
They are among a small, but growing, number of Americans who live "off the grid."
